translation.text: Train 654, scheduled to arrive Chicago 4:10 PM, is operating with an extensive delay due to earlier track equipment striking a vehicle. Metra apologizes for this delay and we thank you for your patience.
The Randolph elevator is back in service.
MDN-Train #2121, scheduled to arrive Fox Lake at 4:22 P.M., may be operating 15 to 25 minutes behind schedule due to an Amtrak Derailment. Please visit metra.com for current delay information.
The Homewood platform elevator is out of service. Alternate accessible stations are Calumet or Flossmoor.

Train 631, scheduled to arrive Crystal Lake at 4:00 PM, is operating with an extensive delay due to earlier track equipment striking a vehicle. Metra apologizes for this delay and we thank you for your patience.
Train #629 will not operate due to earlier track equipment striking a vehicle.  Train #631 will accommodate Customers to Crystal Lake.  Train #637 will be the next train to Harvard.
Train #660 will not operate due to earlier track equipment striking a vehicle. The next inbound train will #668 from Harvard.
Inbound and outbound trains may be operating with extensive delays due to earlier track equipment striking a vehicle.  Please visit metra.com for current delay times.
Metra Alert ME - Homewood East Side Construction Will Begin March 13

Beginning Monday, March 13, access to the Homewood Station from the east will be closed for station construction until Summer 2024.  Access to the boarding platform will be through the Park Avenue entrance ONLY (west side of tracks).

 

Beginning, Monday, March 6, the Pace bus stop will relocate from Harwood Avenue to Park Avenue.  Please allow additional time and use caution near the work zone.
Metra Alert RI - Construction begins April 21 at 103rd Street Washington Heights Station.
Metra forces will begin work Friday, April 21 on a major rehab project at the 103rd Street/Washington Heights Station on the Rock Island Line, for more informaiton click here.
Metra Alert MD-N - Milwaukee West/North and North Central Service train delays and operational changes affecting evening rush hour

Milwaukee West, Milwaukee North, and North Central Service trains may incur delays as well as operational changes during the evening’s rush hour due to ongoing repairs as a result of an Amtrak train derailment. Some trains will depart from a different platform than normal at Chicago Union Station. Check gate boards and listen to announcements prior to boarding your train. If you have questions or need assistance, please see Metra personnel. Milwaukee North train #2135 will not operate and train #2139 will accommodate passengers, Milwaukee West train #2405 will not operate and #2225 will accommodate passengers, and #2229 will not operate and #2227 will accommodate passengers. Updates will be provided as more information becomes available.
